benchmark_details.name: TCM-3CEval
benchmark_details.overview: TCM-3CEval is a benchmark assessing large language models (LLMs) in Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) across three dimensions: core knowledge mastery, classical text understanding, and clinical decision-making. It sets a standard for evaluating AI systems in TCM and provides insights for optimizing LLMs in culturally grounded medical domains.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To establish a scientific evaluation framework for assessing LLMs' capabilities in Traditional Chinese Medicine.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The test sets are primarily derived from literature cases and require future validation through real-world clinical electronic medical records.

data.source: Constructed high-quality exercise sets based on TCM textbooks, classical literature, and clinical cases.
data.size: 150 questions per dataset across various dimensions, totaling 450 questions.
data.annotation: Reviewed and revised by TCM experts to ensure accuracy and representativeness.

methodology.calculation: Model outputs are compared against correct answers to assess understanding and application of TCM knowledge.
methodology.interpretation: Consistency in responses is considered a pass only if all outputs agree on the same correct answer.
methodology.baseline_results: DeepSeek demonstrated significant advantages in key metrics: 88.59% accuracy in TCM-Exam, 71.81% accuracy in TCM-LitQA, and 78.52% accuracy in TCM-MRCD.
methodology.validation: Evaluation methods designed to rigorously assess model capabilities in TCM.
